claim.text: DAMCS outperforms both MARL and LLM baselines in task efficiency and collaboration.
claim.exact_quote: DAMCS outperforms both MARL and LLM baselines in task efficiency and collaboration.

evidence.evidence_text: Figure 6 and Table 1 show that DAMCS achieves the goal with 63% fewer steps in the two-agent scenario and 74% fewer steps in the six-agent scenario compared to the LLM basic agent.
evidence.limitations: Results are specific to the Multi-Agent Crafter environment and may not generalize to other environments.

evaluation.justification: The evidence supports the claim by demonstrating the superior performance of DAMCS in the Multi-Agent Crafter environment.

claim.text: The Adaptive Knowledge Graph Memory System (A-KGMS) enables agents to learn from past experiences and facilitates task completion in open-world environments.
claim.exact_quote: The Adaptive Knowledge Graph Memory System (A-KGMS) enables agents to learn from past experiences and facilitates task completion in open-world environments.

evidence.evidence_text: The memory system allows agents to set goals in an achievable order and prevents them from repeating efforts (Section 5.2).
evidence.limitations: The evaluation is based on a single scenario (Multi-Agent Crafter) and may not be comprehensive.
evidence.exact_quote: The memory system allows agents to set goals in an achievable order and prevents them from repeating efforts.

evaluation.justification: The evidence supports the claim by demonstrating the benefits of A-KGMS in facilitating task completion.

claim.text: The Structured Communication System (S-CS) ensures that agents exchange only the most relevant information, minimizing unnecessary communication overhead.
claim.exact_quote: The Structured Communication System (S-CS) ensures that agents exchange only the most relevant information, minimizing unnecessary communication overhead.

evidence.evidence_text: The S-CS enables agents to efficiently distribute tasks, work independently on simpler objectives, and collaborate on more complex tasks (Section 5.2).
evidence.limitations: The evaluation is based on a single scenario (Multi-Agent Crafter) and may not be comprehensive.
evidence.exact_quote: The S-CS enables agents to efficiently distribute tasks, work independently on simpler objectives, and collaborate on more complex tasks.

evaluation.justification: The evidence supports the claim by demonstrating the benefits of S-CS in minimizing communication overhead and improving task efficiency.
